result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 13

01:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Det. K.B. sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA. Witness identified defn. Cross exam by Atty Rolf. Redirect by ADA. Witness excused. State moved for bindover. Court found probable cause and ordered bindover.
Atty Kara Rolf
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Wayne A except only by telephone.

02:11 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Amy M Johnson.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
